boat.name: Mai Star II
boat.full_description:
Simon Papendick has researched Mai Star II's history from 1939 until 1973 when it goes off the radar until 1985. If anyone can help fill in the missing years, please get in touch. It seems likely that the boat was started in 1939, but not launched until the Spring of 1946, after the Second World War, under the name 'Gadfly II', for her owner Mr H C Doughty of Margate, who is likely to have owned her sister ship 'Gadfly I' before the war.

Following an extensive restoration and refit to replace some damaged planking and ribs, as well as having a new cabin sides and roof made and fitted over the winter 2014/2015 and the winter/spring of 2016, current owner, Simon Papendick got her back in the water late 2015 and sailing again in 2016.
boat.construction_details: Carvel wood, cast iron ballast internal and on keel
boat.short_description: One of three boats called Gadfly built for Mr H.C Doughty of Margate, who originally owned Gadfly in 1939. Her owner finished a long restoration ashore in September 2015 and completed her afloat over the winter months.
